channel.title: Why wont this work?
channel.description:
Ok i have my GUI i want to open up a another frame by pressing a button for my bibliography to pop up.
so in my button i have [code]a = new Bibliography();[/code]
and yes i have declared a.. [code]public static Bibliography a;[/code]
Now this is the constructor in a different class.
[code] public Bibliography() { a = new JFrame("Bibliography");
a.pack(); a.setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE); a.setVisible(true); a.setResizable(false);
tA = new JTextArea("line 1
" + "line2
" + "line3
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line4
" + "line5
" + "line6
" + "line7
" + "line8
", 25, 55);
tA.setLineWrap(true); tA.setWrapStyleWord(true);
tA.setEditable(false);
tA.append("line9");
tA.setBackground(Color.BLACK); tA.setForeground(Color.WHITE);
a.add(new JScrollPane(tA)); }[/code]
Could anyone tell me how to make this work?

item.title: Why wont this work?
item.dc:creator: @X-VOScape X-VOScape
item.description:
@X-VOScape wrote:

Im very sorry everyone for wasting your time! I check and found that i actually didnt add the action listeners… When i did i got errors lol. Then i check and I hadnt even implemented it!

Read full topic

item.title: Why wont this work?
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

remove_later:

Instead of making JFrame your SuperClass why not take the time to make a new JFrame instance and call the methods off that?

It appears he did both. He used instances and extended JFrame.

The JFrame shows when theconstructor is called… it doesnt look very nice, but shows none the less. He needs to show more code around where he calls a = new Bibliography()

Read full topic

item.title: Why wont this work?
item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:18, topic:142163”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=194564.msg1748779#msg1748779 date=1189513353]
well for one your code is appalling, why do you pack it and set it visible before you have added the components?
[/quote]

exacly what i was thinking usualy the setVisible(true); is the last thinng i run[/quote]

That shouldn’t be the problem though. If the constructor is called, then it should still show a window. Even if he isnt setting the rigth variable, if he called the constructor then a window should pop up. It doesn’t though, so its most likely a problem where he is trying to call the constructor.

Read full topic

item.title: Why wont this work?
item.dc:creator: @X-VOScape X-VOScape
item.description:
@X-VOScape wrote:

Ok i have my GUI i want to open up a another frame by pressing a button for my bibliography to pop up.

so in my button i have

a = new Bibliography();

and yes i have declared a…

public static Bibliography a;

Now this is the constructor in a different class.

[code] public Bibliography()
{
a = new JFrame(“Bibliography”);

	a.pack();
	a.setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	a.setVisible(true);
	a.setResizable(false);
	
	tA = new JTextArea("line 1\n"
	+ "line2\n"
	+ "line3\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line4\n"
	+ "line5\n"
	+ "line6\n"
	+ "line7\n"
	+ "line8\n", 25, 55);
	
	tA.setLineWrap(true);
	tA.setWrapStyleWord(true);
	
	tA.setEditable(false);
	
	tA.append("line9");
	
	tA.setBackground(Color.BLACK);
	tA.setForeground(Color.WHITE);
	
	a.add(new JScrollPane(tA));
}[/code]

Could anyone tell me how to make this work?

Read full topic
